#summary How to do a transitfeed release

= Run tests =

Make sure you have nose installed. Run the tests in trunk in Linux and Windows. Manually start the schedule viewer, click on a stop (an info window of next departures should open), click on a trip and its shape should be displayed with stop times.

= Find changes since last release =

Find the revision of the last release with {{{svn ls -v https://googletransitdatafeed.googlecode.com/svn/tags}}}. Display a log of changes with {{{svn log -r xxx:HEAD https://googletransitdatafeed.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/python}}}.

= Tag release =

Check that {{{transitfeed.__version__}}} is correct. Then
{{{svn cp -m "make version x.y.z tag" https://googletransitdatafeed.googlecode.com/svn/trunk https://googletransitdatafeed.googlecode.com/svn/tags/transitfeed-x.y.z}}}

= Build and upload files =

See also BuildingPythonWindowsExecutables. Get a clean copy of the version with {{{svn export https://googletransitdatafeed.googlecode.com/svn/tags/transitfeed-x.y.z/python transitfeed-x.y.z}}}. Build the source tar ball in unix with {{{python setup.py sdist}}}. Upload it to this project. Then update PyPI with {{{python setup.py register sdist}}}.

= Update change log = 

Edit the wiki page TransitFeedDistribution using information gathered from svn log.
